subject: Ethics
title: The Milgram Obedience Shock
description: One-minute skill: The Milgram Obedience Shock.

hook.text: 65% of ordinary people delivered what they believed were fatal electric shocksâ€”because a man in a lab coat told them.

buildup.text: Stanley Milgram wanted to understand how Holocaust perpetrators justified 'just following orders.'

discovery.text: Participants thought they were shocking a learner for wrong answers. The screams were fake, the obedience real.

twist.text: Many subjects were visibly distressed but kept going. Authority overrode their own moral judgment.

climax.text: Milgram showed that evil doesn't require evil peopleâ€”just ordinary people and a convincing authority.

punchline.text: Ordinary people, extraordinary cruelty. Just add authority.

quiz.question: What was the most disturbing finding of the Milgram experiment?
options: Only psychopaths were willing to deliver shocks to the learner
Participants enjoyed the experiment and volunteered to increase the voltage
65% of ordinary people obeyed authority even when they believed they were causing lethal harm
